articles.author: Ben Proudfoot
articles.title: Almost Famous: The Other Fab Four
articles.description: In the mid-1960s, four teenagers from Liverpool were changing the face of pop music. Their names were Mary, Sylvia, Pam and Val.
articles.content: In the mid-1960s, four teenagers from Liverpool were changing the face of pop music. Their names were Mary, Sylvia, Pam and Val.

articles.author: Mark Landler
articles.title: Boris Johnson Has a Mandate. Now, What Will He Do With It?
articles.description: After a consequential but strangely inconclusive election, the prime minister still has not said what he means by Brexit.
articles.content:
Analysts are also looking at particular parts of the country where pressure on Mr. Johnson could mount from inside his own party. 
In Stoke-on-Trent, for example, Conservatives now hold all three Parliamentary seats. The region is heavily dependent on cerami… [+1262 chars]

articles.author: Anupam B. Jena, Marc Lerchenmueller and Olav Sorenson
articles.title: Men Call Their Own Research ‘Excellent’
articles.description: Women do so much less often. And it’s not because their work isn’t as good.
articles.content: Studies in the sciences have reached similar conclusions. A textual analysis of approximately 7,000 research grant proposals to the Gates Foundation found that despite grant reviewers not knowing the identity of the applicant, women received lower application… [+1462 chars]
